content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    pattern = r"```julia\n([^\n]*\n*)\1\n```"

    # Use a capturing group to capture the content between the code fences
    content = match(pattern, md)[1]

    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from each line
    cleaned_content = replace(content, r"\s+" => " ")

    # Join all lines with a newline
    joined_code = join(split(cleaned_content, "\n"), "\n")

    return joined_code
end
```

This function uses a regular expression to match Julia code blocks that are surrounded by triple backticks (````julia`). It captures the content between the code fences and then removes leading and trailing whitespace from each line using `replace` with a regex to match one or more whitespace characters (`r"\s+"`). Finally, it joins all lines with a newline using `join`.
